name: PacMacro
points: PacMan; but in real life.
Players connect to PacMacro on mobile devices with cellular data.
GPS information is streamed to connected players and visible on a map.
PacMacro ran with approx. 50 attendees during SFU CSSS's Frosh Week 2023.

name: AI for Education Resources
points: Repository of AI resources for educational purposes.

name: GAOL: Graphics And Object Library
points: 2D graphics engine intended for particle simulations.

name: Quadrangles
points: Social media with real-time commenting and file upload capabilities.
Commenting takes advantage of the concurrency of goroutines.
WebSockets route communications of active users.
innerHTML: Quadrangles is live! If you are a student at Simon Fraser University, you will be able to post.

name: goblitz.net
points: (First iteration of Quadrangles; real-time commenting is not implemented.)
Designed an in-memory database and API using Go.
Frontend is created with React and deployed with Node.js.

name: Yell Networking Library
points: Decentralized networking library with peer-discovery and binary communication for C and C++ programs.
Library operates parallel to dependant programs with POSIX multithreading.
Received Best Paper Honorable Mention award after presentation during Undergraduate Research Symposium at SFU.

name: Computing Science Forums
points: Worked with hackathon team to design a database that stores uploaded content.
This database (written in C) is capable of communicating with a Flask server through sockets.

name: Exeirus Alternative Reality Game
points: Lead a month-long event where participants solve cryptography puzzles competitively.
Oversaw development of JavaScript games and C encryption/decryption programs.

name: qsim
points: Predicts trajectories of particles using mathematical formulae for gravitational and electromagnetic forces.
Implemented file format to describe experiments and particle information with high numerical precision.
